events.title: Egypt and Israel Sign the Egypt-Israel Peace Treaty
events.description: The Egypt-Israel Peace Treaty was signed, marking the first peace agreement between Israel and an Arab country, following the Camp David Accords.
events.significance: This treaty ended hostilities between the two nations and marked a significant step toward peace in the Middle East.

events.title: Bangladesh Declares Independence from Pakistan
events.description: East Pakistan declared its independence, starting the Bangladesh Liberation War that eventually led to the creation of an independent Bangladesh.
events.significance: This declaration was a pivotal moment leading to the creation of Bangladesh and reshaping South Asian geopolitics.

events.title: Long March Begins in China
events.description: The Chinese Communist Party, under Mao Zedong, began the Long March, a strategic retreat that shaped the future direction of the Chinese revolution.
events.significance: The Long March became a seminal event in Chinese Communist history and Mao's leadership.

events.title: The Congress Party Wins Indian Elections
events.description: The Indian National Congress party led by Indira Gandhi won a decisive victory in general elections, solidifying her political leadership.
events.significance: This victory consolidated Indira Gandhi's role as a dominant figure in Indian politics.

events.title: Spanish Civil War Ends
events.description: Madrid fell to Franco's forces, effectively ending the Spanish Civil War with the establishment of Francisco Franco's dictatorship.
events.significance: The war's conclusion led to nearly four decades of dictatorship in Spain and significant European political ramifications.
